metadata.title: CVE-2021-3177 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Python 3.x through 3.9.1 has a buffer overflow in PyCArg_repr in_ctypes/callproc.c, which may lead to remote code execution in certainPython applications that accept floating-point numbers as untrusted input,as demonstrated by a 1e300 argument to c_double.from_param. This occursbecause sprintf is used unsafely.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3177` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm10
libpython2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm10
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm10
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm10
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm10
python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm10
python2.7-examples - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm10
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

idle-python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm10
libpython3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm10
libpython3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm10
libpython3.4-stdlib - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm10
libpython3.4-testsuite - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm10
python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm10
python3.4-examples - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm10
python3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm10
python3.4-venv - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm10').
python3.4 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm10').
python3.5 package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
